page.title: 19ECOLOGY(2)-GALSTON
page.content: An awareness of the ecological value of the area has prompted conservation minded pupils at Loudoun Academy to mastermind many projects.They have planted trees at several schools in the valley;which improved the appearance of the schools;they transformed an old rubbish tip on the verge of the Glasgow Road into an attractive picnic area,and erected several bird tables in the Cessnock Gardens and at Kirklandside hospital. The Club also constructed a Nature Trail which can be used by all schools and Youth Organisations.The Club then cleared overhanging vegetation and drained water from an old pond, transforming it into a deep pond,ideal for the study of plant and animal life.Water diviners were used to find a spring which now runs into the pond.
